intro: Willemetia stipitata subsp. stipitata, commonly known as the slender-stemmed willemetia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
